speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Are you good men and true?

speaker: VERGES
text: Yea, or else it were pity but they should suffer

speaker: VERGES
text: salvation, body and soul.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Nay, that were a punishment too good for

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: them if they should have any allegiance in them,

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: being chosen for the Prince’s watch.

speaker: VERGES
text: Well, give them their charge, neighbor

speaker: VERGES
text: Dogberry.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: First, who think you the most desartless

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: man to be constable?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: Hugh Oatcake, sir, or George Seacoal,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: for they can write and read.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Come hither, neighbor Seacoal.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: God hath blessed you with a good

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: name. To be a well-favored man is the gift of

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: fortune, but to write and read comes by nature.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: Both which, master constable—

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: You have. I knew it would be your answer.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Well, for your favor, sir, why, give God thanks, and

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: make no boast of it, and for your writing and

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: reading, let that appear when there is no need of

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: such vanity. You are thought here to be the most

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: senseless and fit man for the constable of the watch;

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: therefore bear you the lantern. This is your charge:

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: you shall comprehend all vagrom men; you are to

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: bid any man stand, in the Prince’s name.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: How if he will not stand?

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Why, then, take no note of him, but let him

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: go, and presently call the rest of the watch together

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: and thank God you are rid of a knave.

speaker: VERGES
text: If he will not stand when he is bidden, he is

speaker: VERGES
text: none of the Prince’s subjects.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: True, and they are to meddle with none but

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: the Prince’s subjects.—You shall also make no

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: noise in the streets; for, for the watch to babble and

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: to talk is most tolerable and not to be endured.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              WATCHMAN
text: We will rather sleep than talk.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              WATCHMAN
text: We know what belongs to a watch.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Why, you speak like an ancient and most

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: quiet watchman, for I cannot see how sleeping

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: should offend; only have a care that your bills be not

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: stolen. Well, you are to call at all the alehouses and

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: bid those that are drunk get them to bed.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: How if they will not?

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Why then, let them alone till they are sober.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: If they make you not then the better answer, you

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: may say they are not the men you took them for.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: Well, sir.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: If you meet a thief, you may suspect him, by

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: virtue of your office, to be no true man, and for such

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: kind of men, the less you meddle or make with

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: them, why, the more is for your honesty.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: If we know him to be a thief, shall we not

speaker: SEACOAL
text: lay hands on him?

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Truly, by your office you may, but I think

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: they that touch pitch will be defiled. The most

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: peaceable way for you, if you do take a thief, is to

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: let him show himself what he is and steal out of

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: your company.

speaker: VERGES
text: You have been always called a merciful man,

speaker: VERGES
text: partner.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Truly, I would not hang a dog by my will,

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: much more a man who hath any honesty in him.

speaker: VERGES
text: If you hear a child cry in the

speaker: VERGES
text: night, you must call to the nurse and bid her still it.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              WATCHMAN
text: How if the nurse be asleep and

speaker:
SECOND
               
              WATCHMAN
text: will not hear us?

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Why, then depart in peace, and let the

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: child wake her with crying, for the ewe that will

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: not hear her lamb when it baas will never answer a

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: calf when he bleats.

speaker: VERGES
text: ’Tis very true.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: This is the end of the charge. You, constable,

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: are to present the Prince’s own person. If you

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: meet the Prince in the night, you may stay him.

speaker: VERGES
text: Nay, by ’r Lady, that I think he cannot.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Five shillings to one on ’t, with any man that

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: knows the statutes, he may stay him—marry, not

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: without the Prince be willing, for indeed the watch

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: ought to offend no man, and it is an offense to stay a

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: man against his will.

speaker: VERGES
text: By ’r Lady, I think it be so.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Ha, ah ha!—Well, masters, goodnight. An

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: there be any matter of weight chances, call up me.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Keep your fellows’ counsels and your own, and

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: goodnight.—Come, neighbor.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: Well, masters, we hear our charge. Let us go

speaker: SEACOAL
text: sit here upon the church bench till two, and then all

speaker: SEACOAL
text: to bed.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: One word more, honest neighbors. I pray

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: you watch about Signior Leonato’s door, for the

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: wedding being there tomorrow, there is a great coil

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: tonight. Adieu, be vigitant, I beseech you.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: What, Conrade!

speaker: SEACOAL
text: Peace, stir not.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Conrade, I say!

speaker: CONRADE
text: Here, man, I am at thy elbow.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Mass, and my elbow itched, I thought there

speaker: BORACHIO
text: would a scab follow.

speaker: CONRADE
text: I will owe thee an answer for that. And now

speaker: CONRADE
text: forward with thy tale.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Stand thee close, then, under this penthouse,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: for it drizzles rain, and I will, like a true

speaker: BORACHIO
text: drunkard, utter all to thee.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: Some treason, masters. Yet stand

speaker: SEACOAL
text: close.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Therefore know, I have earned of Don

speaker: BORACHIO
text: John a thousand ducats.

speaker: CONRADE
text: Is it possible that any villainy should be so

speaker: CONRADE
text: dear?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Thou shouldst rather ask if it were possible

speaker: BORACHIO
text: any villainy should be so rich. For when rich

speaker: BORACHIO
text: villains have need of poor ones, poor ones may

speaker: BORACHIO
text: make what price they will.

speaker: CONRADE
text: I wonder at it.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: That shows thou art unconfirmed. Thou

speaker: BORACHIO
text: knowest that the fashion of a doublet, or a hat, or a

speaker: BORACHIO
text: cloak, is nothing to a man.

speaker: CONRADE
text: Yes, it is apparel.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: I mean the fashion.

speaker: CONRADE
text: Yes, the fashion is the fashion.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Tush, I may as well say the fool’s the fool.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: But seest thou not what a deformed thief this

speaker: BORACHIO
text: fashion is?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: I know that Deformed. He

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: has been a vile thief this seven year. He goes up and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: down like a gentleman. I remember his name.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Didst thou not hear somebody?

speaker: CONRADE
text: No, ’twas the vane on the house.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Seest thou not, I say, what a deformed thief

speaker: BORACHIO
text: this fashion is, how giddily he turns about all the

speaker: BORACHIO
text: hot bloods between fourteen and five-and-thirty,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: sometimes fashioning them like Pharaoh’s soldiers

speaker: BORACHIO
text: in the reechy painting, sometimes like god Bel’s

speaker: BORACHIO
text: priests in the old church window, sometimes like

speaker: BORACHIO
text: the shaven Hercules in the smirched worm-eaten

speaker: BORACHIO
text: tapestry, where his codpiece seems as massy as his

speaker: BORACHIO
text: club?

speaker: CONRADE
text: All this I see, and I see that the fashion wears

speaker: CONRADE
text: out more apparel than the man. But art not thou

speaker: CONRADE
text: thyself giddy with the fashion too, that thou hast

speaker: CONRADE
text: shifted out of thy tale into telling me of the

speaker: CONRADE
text: fashion?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Not so, neither. But know that I have tonight

speaker: BORACHIO
text: wooed Margaret, the Lady Hero’s gentlewoman,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: by the name of Hero. She leans me out at

speaker: BORACHIO
text: her mistress’ chamber window, bids me a thousand

speaker: BORACHIO
text: times goodnight. I tell this tale vilely. I should first

speaker: BORACHIO
text: tell thee how the Prince, Claudio, and my master,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: planted and placed and possessed by my master

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Don John, saw afar off in the orchard this amiable

speaker: BORACHIO
text: amiable encounter.

speaker: CONRADE
text: And thought they Margaret was Hero?

speaker: BORACHIO
text: Two of them did, the Prince and Claudio,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: but the devil my master knew she was Margaret;

speaker: BORACHIO
text: and partly by his oaths, which first possessed them,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: partly by the dark night, which did deceive them,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: but chiefly by my villainy, which did confirm any

speaker: BORACHIO
text: slander that Don John had made, away went Claudio

speaker: BORACHIO
text: enraged, swore he would meet her as he was

speaker: BORACHIO
text: appointed next morning at the temple, and there,

speaker: BORACHIO
text: before the whole congregation, shame her with

speaker: BORACHIO
text: what he saw o’ernight and send her home again

speaker: BORACHIO
text: without a husband.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: We charge you in the Prince’s name

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: stand!

speaker: SEACOAL
text: Call up the right Master Constable.

speaker: SEACOAL
text: We have here recovered the most

speaker: SEACOAL
text: dangerous piece of lechery that ever was known in

speaker: SEACOAL
text: the commonwealth.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: And one Deformed is one of them. I

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: know him; he wears a lock.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Masters, masters—

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: You’ll be made bring

speaker:
FIRST
               
              WATCHMAN
text: Deformed forth, I warrant you.

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: Masters, never

speaker: DOGBERRY
text: speak, we charge you, let us obey you to go with us.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: We are like to prove a goodly

speaker: BORACHIO
text: commodity, being taken up of these men’s bills.

speaker: CONRADE
text: A commodity in question, I warrant you.—

speaker: CONRADE
text: Come, we’ll obey you.
